    PlotPlotly

    PlotPlotly.Rd

    Plotly Module

    Super classes

    DarwinShinyModules::ShinyModule -> DarwinShinyModules::Plot -> PlotPlotly

    Active bindings

    plot

    (plotly) object.

    source

    (character) Source label for the plotly plot.

    bindingds

    (reactivevalues) bindings from the plotly object.

    Methods

    Public methods

    • PlotPlotly$new()

    • PlotPlotly$UI()

    • PlotPlotly$server()

    • PlotPlotly$clone()

    Inherited methods
    • DarwinShinyModules::ShinyModule$id()
    • DarwinShinyModules::Plot$updateDataReactive()
    • DarwinShinyModules::Plot$validate()

    Method new()

    initialize

    Usage

    PlotPlotly$new(appId, data, fun)

    Arguments

    appId

    (character(1)) ID of the app, to use for namespacing.

    data

    Data to plot with, usually a data.frame-like object.

    fun

    Function to plot with, with one argument: data.

    Returns

    self

    Method UI()

    UI

    Usage

    PlotPlotly$UI(title = "Plotly")

    Arguments

    title

    (character(1)) Title to use for the plot.

    Returns

    shiny.tag.list server

    Method server()

    Usage

    PlotPlotly$server(input, output, session)

    Arguments

    input

    (input)

    output

    (output)

    session

    (session)

    Returns

    NULL

    Method clone()

    The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

    Usage

    PlotPlotly$clone(deep = FALSE)

    Arguments

    deep

    Whether to make a deep clone.

    Examples

    library(DarwinShinyModules)

plotlyFun <- function(data) {
  plotly::ggplotly(
    ggplot(data = data, mapping = aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +
      geom_point() +
      theme_bw()
  )
}

plotlyModule <- PlotPlotly$new(appId = "app", data = iris, fun = plotlyFun)

if (interactive()) {
  preview(plotlyModule)
}
